word_mean_info__list.difference: 普通用词，多指上级对下级，主人对仆人以及教师对学生等发出的命令，也指态度专横地命令他人。
话意强，指正式下令，强调下令者的权威性，要求必须服从。
与order同义，但较正式，文学意味强，多指口头直接下的命令。
普通用词，侧重指具体的命令。
正式用词，指口头或书面的指示或命令。内容不一定详尽，语气较缓和，不太强调强制性。也可指指导性的说明。
较正式用词，强调权威性、全局性和强制性。
书面用词，指不容违反、不容推翻的命令。也多指包含具体说明的指示。

list.abstract: order，是英语单词，英 [ˈɔ:də(r)] 美 [ˈɔ:rdə(r)] n.命令；次序；规则；[贸易]订单 vt.命令；整理；订购 vi.命令；订货
ORDER是一支来自澳洲的电子竞技战队。

yingyinNormal.en: We're changing the order we do things. Read to me first, kid. Then we make love.
yingyinNormal.zh: 我们把顺序改改吧。先给我念书，孩子。然后我们做爱。

yingyinNormal.en: You need to put something in your stomach, William. Toast, pills, juice. That's the order. Okay?
yingyinNormal.zh: 你得先吃点东西垫垫胃，威廉。吐司，药片和果汁，按这顺序来，好吗？

yingyinNormal.en: It's the right ingredients, but in the wrong order. In a proper sandwich, the cheese is adjacent to the bread to create a moisture barrier against the lettuce.
yingyinNormal.zh: 东西确实一样，但是顺序不对啊，一个合格的三明治它的芝士要紧贴着面包，这样会提供给生菜一个有水分的屏障。

yingyinNormal.en: Undoubtedly another snide response to my repeated letters complaining that the flags in front of the courthouse are flying in the wrong order. From left to right, it's supposed to be federal, state, and then city of Pasadena.
yingyinNormal.zh: 肯定又是回信来鄙视我之前寄去的几封信里投诉了法院门口的旗子次序是错误的，按照从左到右的顺序 应该先是联邦旗，州旗，最后才轮到帕萨迪纳市旗。

yingyinNormal.en: Um, we're ready to order.
yingyinNormal.zh: 我们要点餐了。

yingyinNormal.en: My God. What did you order?
yingyinNormal.zh: 我的天，你点了什么菜？

yingyinNormal.en: Hey. So you guys ready to order?
yingyinNormal.zh: 你们准备点菜了吗？

yingyinNormal.en: Somebody order a pizza? Oh, that's me!
yingyinNormal.zh: 有人定比萨饼了吗？哦，是我。

yingyinNormal.en: Alternatively, we could order a pizza?
yingyinNormal.zh: 或者，我们可以订披萨？

yingyinNormal.en: Here's your lemonade. I didn't order lemonade.
yingyinNormal.zh: 你的柠檬汁。我没有叫柠檬汁。

yingyinNormal.en: You didn't cancel the fabric order from Taiwan?
yingyinNormal.zh: 你没有取消台湾的布料订单？

yingyinNormal.en: Hey, you guys ready to order? Sure. Okay, Priya?
yingyinNormal.zh: 你们想好点啥菜了吗？想好了。好的，普丽娅？

yingyinNormal.en: The President signed an Executive Order this morning.
yingyinNormal.zh: 总统今早签署了一份行政命令。

yingyinNormal.en: Okay. Stop ruining Valentine's Day and order my pizza.
yingyinNormal.zh: 可以了，别扫情人节的雅兴，快给我叫披萨外送。

yingyinNormal.en: 16 wants to order appetizers. Oh, thanks. This was nice.
yingyinNormal.zh: 16桌要点头盘。谢谢。刚才的时光也很美好。

yingyinNormal.en: I'm ready to order.
yingyinNormal.zh: 我要点餐。

yingyinNormal.en: And if you order the first dish in column A, you can't order the corresponding dish in column B.
yingyinNormal.zh: 如果你点了A栏里的第一道菜，你就不能点B栏里的第一道菜了。

yingyinNormal.en: Get out of there. That's an order. Permission to defy order. Permission denied. Then I deny your denial.
yingyinNormal.zh: 离开那儿！这是命令！允许违抗命令。驳回允许！我驳回你的驳回！

yingyinNormal.en: You want to get off your high horse? This is the woman who thinks karaoke is a 21st century art. Order. Order.
yingyinNormal.zh: 你能别那么傲慢吗？就是这女人认为卡拉OK是21世纪当代艺术。肃静，肃静。

yingyinNormal.en: In order to take a vacation, one first has to work.
yingyinNormal.zh: 想度假，先工作。

direction_info.description:
数据源自2012-2023年12年间全国考研试卷，由搜狗翻译进行大数据分析汇总，数据仅供参考。

<highlight> 考频分布</highlight>
由搜狗翻译收集历年真题试卷、汇总单词出现的总频次、释义分布。题型选自2012-2023年全国考研英语一和考研英语二共24套考研试卷，包括阅读、完型填空、翻译、写作等所有题型。

<highlight> 考纲释义</highlight>
精选全国考研考纲词汇、单词义项，由搜狗大数据与考纲、历年真题进行匹配。

<highlight>真题例句</highlight>
精选2012-2023年12年间全国考研英语一和考研英语二试卷，由搜狗大数据与搜索内容匹配历年真题例句。

examination_example.sentence: In <highlight>order</highlight> to ensure that elite women have more such opportunities, they have proposed imposing government quotas.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 为了确保精英女性有更多这样的机会，他们提议实施政府配额。

examination_example.sentence: In <highlight>order</highlight> to make the most of our focus and energy, we also need to embrace downtime, or as Newport suggests, "be lazy".
examination_example.sentence_trans: 为了充分利用我们的注意力和精力，我们也需要休息，或者像纽波特建议的那样，"偷懒"。

examination_example.sentence: In <highlight>order</highlight> to increase sales, they should create a "third stepping stone" between infant wear and older kids' clothes.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 为了增加销量，他们应该在婴儿服装和大一点的儿童服装之间开辟“第三块垫脚石”。

examination_example.sentence: The <highlight>order</highlight> also declared that state and local governments couldn't regulate broadband providers either.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 该命令还宣布，州和地方政府也不能监管宽带提供商。

examination_example.sentence: The appeals court unanimously upheld the 2017 <highlight>order</highlight> deregulating broadband providers.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 上诉法院一致支持2017年解除对宽带提供商管制的命令。

examination_example.sentence: A judge has now overruled the city's decision to stop levying fines, <highlight>ordering</highlight> them reinstated.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 一名法官现在驳回了该市停止征收罚款的决定，命令恢复罚款。

examination_example.sentence: Beethoven's music tends to move from chaos to <highlight>order</highlight> as if <highlight>order</highlight> were an imperative of human existence.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 贝多芬的音乐往往从混乱走向秩序，仿佛秩序是人类生存的必需品。

examination_example.sentence: For him, <highlight>order</highlight> does not result from forgetting or ignoring the disorders that plague our existence.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 对于他而言，忘记或忽略那些困扰人类生存的混乱并不能换来秩序。

examination_example.sentence: The second takes a more empirical approach to universality, identifying traits (particularly in word <highlight>order</highlight>) shared by many languages.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 第二种对普遍性采取了更实证的方法，识别出许多语言共有的特征(尤其是语序)。

examination_example.sentence: It will return with a vengeance if the justified anger of passengers is not addressed in short <highlight>order</highlight>.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 如果乘客合理的愤怒不能迅速得到解决，它将卷土重来。

word_usage.usage: order作动词可以接双宾语，表达“为某人点（饭菜等）或订购某物”可以说order sth. for sb.或order sb. sth.

作动词表示“命令”
order指上级、主人等任何权威人物命令他人做某事。
command尤指军官、国王等正式下令，强调下令者的权威性，要求接受命令者必须服从。

exam_freq_info.chinese: 条理; 有序状态; 使有序

direction_info.description:
数据源自2016.6-2023.6年8年间全六级试卷，由搜狗翻译进行大数据分析汇总，数据仅供参考。

<highlight>考纲释义</highlight>
精选实考、考纲词汇、单词义项，由搜狗大数据与考纲、历年真题进行匹配。

<highlight>考频分布</highlight>
由搜狗翻译收集历年真题试卷、汇总单词出现的总频次、释义分布。题型选自2016-2023年51套试卷，包括阅读、听力、翻译等所有题型。

<highlight>真题例句</highlight>
精选2016-2023年8年间全六级试卷，由搜狗大数据与搜索内容匹配历年真题例句。

搜狗翻译拥有最终解释权。

word_usage.usage:
当order作“命令”解时，后面从句要用虚拟语气，即“(should+)动词原形”。如：
他命令门必须锁上。
He ordered that the gate (should) be locked.

当order做动词“预定”时，可接双宾语，其间接宾语可以转化为介词for的宾语，如：
他的父亲给他定做了一件新外衣。
His father has ordered him a new coat. 或 His father has ordered a new coat for him.
order作名词“条理，秩序”解时是不可数名词，out of order等短语中order前不加a。order作名词“命令”解时，是可数名词，常用于复数形式。

exam_freq_info.chinese: 条理; 有序状态; 使有序

direction_info.description:
数据源自2016.6-2023.6年8年间全四级试卷，由搜狗翻译进行大数据分析汇总，数据仅供参考。

<highlight>考纲释义</highlight>
精选实考、考纲词汇、单词义项，由搜狗大数据与考纲、历年真题进行匹配。

<highlight>考频分布</highlight>
由搜狗翻译收集历年真题试卷、汇总单词出现的总频次、释义分布。题型选自2016-2023年51套试卷，包括阅读、听力、翻译等所有题型。

<highlight>真题例句</highlight>
精选2016-2023年8年间试卷，由搜狗大数据与搜索内容匹配历年真题例句。

搜狗翻译拥有最终解释权。

examination_example.sentence: My neighbor installed panels on his roof about a year ago in <highlight>order</highlight> to power his hot water.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 大约一年前，我的邻居在他的屋顶上安装了面板，以便为他的热水供电。

examination_example.sentence: What did industrialists of the late 20th century resort to in <highlight>order</highlight> to mislead Americans?
examination_example.sentence_trans: 为了误导美国人，20世纪末的实业家采取了什么手段？

sense_info_list.en: a request to make; supply; or deliver food or goods

examination_example.sentence: So, which supermarket do you think is the best to <highlight>order</highlight> from?
examination_example.sentence_trans: 那么，你认为从哪个超市订购最好呢？

examination_example.sentence: As you said, there must have been some confusion with the <highlight>order</highlight>.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 如你所说，一定是订单搞混了。

examination_example.sentence: Yes, some people seem to spend a lot of time there and not <highlight>order</highlight> much.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 是的，有些人似乎花了很多时间在那里，但没有购买很多。

sense_info_list.en: a condition of regular or proper arrangement
sense_info_list.zh: 条理; 有序状态; 使有序

examination_example.sentence: His GPS system went out of <highlight>order</highlight>.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 他的GPS系统出了故障。

examination_example.sentence: "I want <highlight>order</highlight> and taste. A well-displayed meal is enhanced one hundred percent in my eyes," he later wrote in one of his cook books.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 他后来在他的一本烹饪书中写道：“我想要让美观和美味并存。在我看来，精心摆放可以百分百地为菜肴增色。”

examination_example.sentence: When governments lose their control on power, law and <highlight>order</highlight> begin to disintegrate.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 当政府失去对权力的控制时，法律和秩序就开始瓦解。

sense_info_list.en: logical or comprehensible arrangement of separate elements

examination_example.sentence: A restructuring of the textbook industry may well be in <highlight>order</highlight>. But this does not mean the end of the textbook itself.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 教科书产业重组势在必行，但这也并不意味着教科书本身的终结。

examination_example.sentence: Other choices, in descending <highlight>order</highlight> of personalization, are: a real-time phone call, a voice-mail message, a handwritten note, a typewritten letter, and the most unfriendly is email.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 以个性化降序排列的其他选择包括：实时电话，语音邮件，手写便条，打字机信件，最不友好的是电子邮件。

examination_example.sentence: Some of these may change <highlight>order</highlight> according to the specific situation or your own preferences; for example, a handwritten note might seem more personal than voice-mail.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 其中一些可能会根据特定情况或您自己的喜好更改顺序。 例如手写便条似乎比语音邮件更有个人风格。

sense_info_list.en: a command given by a superior

examination_example.sentence: Doctor's <highlight>orders</highlight>: Let children just play
examination_example.sentence_trans: 医生嘱咐：让孩子玩就是了

examination_example.sentence: Moose was <highlight>ordered</highlight> to "clean up his act. "
examination_example.sentence_trans: 穆斯被命令“检点行事”。

sense_info_list.en: the state of things when law or authority is obeyed

examination_example.sentence: Then encourage them to establish an <highlight>order</highlight> in which they do work.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 然后鼓励他们建立一个工作秩序。

word_usage.usage: order作名词“条理，秩序”解时是不可数名词，out of order等短语中order前不加a。order作名词“命令”解时，是可数名词，常用于复数形式。

当order作“命令”解时，后面从句要用虚拟语气，即“(should+)动词原形”。如：
他命令门必须锁上。
He ordered that the gate (should) be locked.

当order做动词“预定”时，可接双宾语，其间接宾语可以转化为介词for的宾语，如：
他的父亲给他定做了一件新外衣。
His father has ordered him a new coat. 或 His father has ordered a new coat for him.

direction_info.description:
数据源自2015-2022年8年间全国卷和自主命题省市高考卷，由搜狗翻译进行大数据分析汇总，数据仅供参考。

<highlight> 考频分布</highlight>
由搜狗翻译收集历年真题试卷、汇总单词出现的总频次、释义分布。题型选自2015-2022年全国卷高考试卷，包括阅读、完形、单选、填空、听力、改错、写作等所有题型。

<highlight> 考纲释义</highlight>
精选各省市考纲词汇、单词义项，由搜狗大数据与考纲、历年真题进行匹配。

<highlight>真题例句</highlight>
精选2015-2022年8年间全国卷和自主命题省市高考卷，由搜狗大数据与搜索内容匹配历年真题例句。

搜狗翻译拥有最终解释权。

examination_example.sentence: I can take your <highlight>order</highlight> over the phone.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 我可以在电话里帮你点菜。

examination_example.sentence: Shall I <highlight>order</highlight> a taxi for Sarah to go to the airport tonight?
examination_example.sentence_trans: 今晚我为莎拉叫一辆出租车去机场好吗？

examination_example.sentence: Without even seeing the menu, I knew I'd be <highlight>ordering</highlight> every tomato on it.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 不用看菜单，我就知道我会把所有的番茄都点一遍。

examination_example.sentence: She was extremely pretty, and her house was a reflection of herself, everything in good taste and in perfect <highlight>order</highlight>.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 她非常漂亮，她的房子是她自己的写照，一切都很有品位，井井有条。

examination_example.sentence: Researchers tested the dogs in random <highlight>order</highlight>.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 研究人员以随机顺序对这些狗进行了测试。

examination_example.sentence: For example, let's number the letters of the alphabet, in <highlight>order</highlight>, from 1 to 26.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 例如，让我们给字母表中的字母编号，从1到26。

examination_example.sentence: Before getting into the car, I thought I had learned the instructor's <highlight>orders</highlight>, but once I started the car, my mind went blank.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 在上车之前，我以为我已经学会了教官的命令，但是一旦发动了车，我的脑子就一片空白。

word_usage.usage: in order that只能引导目的状语从句，且可以放在主句之前或之后；so that可引导目的状语从句，也可引导结果状语从句，但只可放在主句之后。
order、suggest、demand等词后的宾语从句用虚拟语气，谓语常用“(should)+动词原形”的形式。

direction_info.description:
数据源自2018-2021年4年间全国各省市中考试卷，由搜狗翻译进行大数据分析汇总，数据仅供参考。

<highlight> 考频分布</highlight>
由搜狗翻译收集历年真题试卷、汇总单词出现的总频次、释义分布。题型选自2018-2021年全国重点省市中考试卷，包括听力、阅读、完形、单选、填空、改错、写作等所有题型。

<highlight> 考纲释义</highlight>
精选各省市考纲词汇、单词义项，由搜狗大数据与考纲、历年真题进行匹配。

<highlight>真题例句</highlight>
精选2018-2021年4年间全国各省市中考试卷，由搜狗大数据与搜索内容匹配历年真题例句。

搜狗翻译拥有最终解释权。

word_level_phrase_info.brief_definition: 良好秩序；良好的秩序；秩序良好
按...顺序；按顺序的；...的次序

examination_example.sentence: While you are travelling, try wearing cloth shoes in <highlight>order</highlight> to improve blood circulation (循环).
examination_example.sentence_trans: 当你旅行时，试着穿布鞋，以改善血液循环。

examination_example.sentence: In <highlight>order</highlight> to protect them, governments around the world have developed laws to stop this.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 为了保护他们，世界各国政府制定了法律来阻止这种情况。

examination_example.sentence: In <highlight>order</highlight> to help Monet complete a scene, the station master even made trains leave later than they should do.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 为了帮助莫奈完成一个场景，站长甚至让火车晚点离开。

sense_info_list.en: a request to make, supply, or deliver food or goods
sense_info_list.zh: 订单; 订货; 购买

examination_example.sentence: Today we can do everything with apps: pay bills, <highlight>order</highlight> food and shop for anything.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 如今，我们可以用应用程序做任何事情：支付账单、点餐和购物。

examination_example.sentence: He helped her cancel the <highlight>order</highlight>.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 他帮她取消了订单。

examination_example.sentence: I <highlight>ordered</highlight> a skirt from you last month, but there are some problems with it.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 我上个月向你订购了一条裙子，但是它有一些问题。

examination_example.sentence: Thank you for telling us the problems with your <highlight>order</highlight>.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 谢谢你告诉我们你的订单有什么问题。

sense_info_list.en: logical or comprehensible arrangement of separate elements

examination_example.sentence: Put the events about Irving in the correct <highlight>order</highlight>.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 将有关欧文的事件按正确的顺序排列。

examination_example.sentence: List upcoming tasks in <highlight>order</highlight> of importance.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 按重要性顺序列出即将到来的任务。

examination_example.sentence: We can learn from the research that birth <highlight>order</highlight> may decide who we are.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 我们可以从研究中了解到，出生顺序可能决定我们是谁。

sense_info_list.en: a command given by a superior

examination_example.sentence: He <highlight>ordered</highlight> them to fight.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 他命令他们战斗。

examination_example.sentence: Cao Cao <highlight>ordered</highlight> his soldiers to shoot arrows towards the sounds of the drums and the shouting.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 曹操命令士兵对着鼓声和叫喊声的方向射箭。

examination_example.sentence: It can understand Mr. Smith's <highlight>orders</highlight>.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 它能理解史密斯先生的命令。

sense_info_list.en: a condition of regular or proper arrangement
sense_info_list.zh: 条理; 有序状态; 使有序

examination_example.sentence: Our monitor Jenny is so organized that she always keeps things in good <highlight>order</highlight>.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 我们的班长珍妮非常有条理，她总是把事情安排得井井有条。

examination_example.sentence: The bridge is sometimes crowded with many visitors, so policemen are there to keep things in <highlight>order</highlight>.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 这座桥有时会挤满许多游客，所以警察会在那里维持秩序。

examination_example.sentence: For example, it was better to put vegetables in <highlight>order</highlight> and bigger ones on top.
examination_example.sentence_trans: 例如，最好把蔬菜摆放整齐，把大的放在上面。

word_usage.usage:
当order作“命令”解时，后面从句要用虚拟语气，即“(should+)动词原形”。如：
他命令门必须锁上。
He ordered that the gate (should) be locked.

当order做动词“预定”时，可接双宾语，其间接宾语可以转化为介词for的宾语，如：
他的父亲给他定做了一件新外衣。
His father has ordered him a new coat. 或 His father has ordered a new coat for him.
order作名词“条理，秩序”解时是不可数名词，out of order等短语中order前不加a。order作名词“命令”解时，是可数名词，常用于复数形式。

in order to和in order that都可以用来引出目的状语,表示“为的是；以便于”，但in order to后跟动词原形,in order that后跟从句。in order to do sth的否定结构是 in order not to do sth“为了不做某事”
如：She arrived early in order to get a good seat.
她早早到场，好找个好座位。（牛津）
I am saving money in order that I can buy a house.
我正在攒钱，以便能买一所房子。

disambiguation_list.sense_disambiguation: 正式用词，指口头或书面的指示或命令。内容不一定详尽，语气较缓和，不太强调强制性。也可指指导性的说明。
书面用词，指不容违反、不容推翻的命令。也多指包含具体说明的指示。
普通用词，侧重指具体的命令。
